Returns: Optional title text to edit instead of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getTitle_E@.
getEditTitle().Description: Returns the optional title text to edit. When not null, it is being edited instead of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getTitle_E@.

Parameters: CharSequence: The description of the action.
setDescription(java.lang.CharSequence).Description: Sets the description of this action.

Returns: true if the action can be activated to edit.
hasEditableActivatorView().Description: Returns whether this action can be activated to edit, e.g. a DatePicker.

Parameters: CharSequence: Optional description text to edit instead of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#setDescription_E@.
setEditDescription(java.lang.CharSequenc.Description: Sets the optional description text to edit instead of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#setDescription_E@.

Returns: true if the action was constructed as having a multiline description, false otherwise.
hasMultilineDescription().Description: Returns whether this action is has a multiline description.

Returns: true if the action is currently checked, false otherwise.
isChecked().Description: Returns whether this action is checked.

Returns: InputType of action title in editing.
getEditInputType().Description: Returns InputType of action title in editing; only valid when @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#isEditable_E@ is true.

Returns: true if will only display information, false otherwise.
infoOnly().Description: Returns whether the action will only display information and is thus not clickable. If both this and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#hasNext_E@ are true, infoOnly takes precedence. The default is false. For example, this might represent e.g. the amount of storage a document uses, or the cost of an app.

Returns: Optional description text to edit instead of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getDescription_E@.
getEditDescription().Description: Returns the optional description text to edit. When not null, it is being edited instead of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getDescription_E@.

Returns: true if the action is currently focusable, false otherwise.
isFocusable().Description: Returns whether this action is focusable.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action should be focusable.
setFocusable(boolean).Description: Sets whether this action is focusable.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action should be checked.
setChecked(boolean).Description: Sets whether this action is checked.

isEditTitleUsed().Description: Returns true if @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getEditTitle_E@ is not null. When true, the @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getEditTitle_E@ is being edited instead of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getTitle_E@.

Returns: The intent set when this action was built.
getIntent().Description: Returns the intent associated with this action.

Parameters: boolean: Whether this action should be enabled.
setEnabled(boolean).Description: Sets whether this action is enabled.

Returns: InputType of action description not in editing.
getDescriptionInputType().Description: Returns InputType of action description not in editing.

Returns: true if the action title is editable, false otherwise.
isEditable().Description: Returns whether this action title is editable.

Returns: true if the action description is editable, false otherwise.
isDescriptionEditable().Description: Returns whether this action description is editable.

Returns: True if this action has editable title or editable description, false otherwise.
hasTextEditable().Description: Returns if this action has editable title or editable description.

Parameters: Intent: New intent to set on this action.
setIntent(android.content.Intent).Description: Sets the intent of this action.

Returns: an integer representing the check set this action is a part of, or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#CHECKBOX_CHECK_SET_ID_E@ if this is a checkbox, or @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#NO_CHECK_SET_E@ if this action is not a checkbox or radiobutton.
getCheckSetId().Description: Returns the check set id this action is a part of. All actions in the same list with the same check set id are considered linked. When one of the actions within that set is selected, that action becomes checked, while all the other actions become unchecked.

getDescription().Description: Returns the description of this action.

Returns: true if the action is currently enabled, false otherwise.
isEnabled().Description: Returns whether this action is enabled.

Returns: true if the action will request further user input when selected, false otherwise.
hasNext().Description: Returns whether this action will request further user input when selected, such as showing another GuidedStepFragment or launching a new activity. Configured during construction.

Returns: True if Action will be saved to instanceState and restored later, false otherwise.
isAutoSaveRestoreEnabled().Description: Returns true if Action will be saved to instanceState and restored later, false otherwise. The default value is true. When isAutoSaveRestoreEnabled() is true and @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Action#getId_E@ is not @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#Action#NO_ID_E@: @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#isEditable_E@ is true: save text of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getTitle_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#isDescriptionEditable_E@ is true: save text of @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getDescription_E@ @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#getCheckSetId_E@ is not @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#NO_CHECK_SET_E@: save @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#isChecked_E@} @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedDatePickerAction_E@ will be saved App may explicitly disable auto restore and handle by itself. App should override Fragment onSaveInstanceState() and onCreateActions()

ClassDesc: A data class which represents an action within a @B_android#support#v17#leanback#app#GuidedStepFragment_E@. GuidedActions contain at minimum a title and a description, and typically also an icon. A GuidedAction typically represents a single action a user may take, but may also represent a possible choice out of a group of mutually exclusive choices (similar to radio buttons), or an information-only label (in which case the item cannot be clicked). GuidedActions may optionally be checked. They may also indicate that they will request further user input on selection, in which case they will be displayed with a chevron indicator. GuidedAction recommends to use @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#Builder_E@. When application subclass GuidedAction, it can subclass @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#BuilderBase_E@, implement its own builder() method where it should call @B_android#support#v17#leanback#widget#GuidedAction#BuilderBase#applyValues_E@.
